about_the_game:
This demo page contains the first of five planned chapters of Divine Omen. Upon their release, chapters 2-5 will be accessible on Divine Omen's main store page.

• • •

Avan did his best to ignore the nightmare from the night before. It was something he'd learned to live with - something he'd dealt with since childhood. It was easy to write them off until the pain he'd felt in his dreams followed him into the morning.

The young man holds his aching hand as he makes his way to the watchtower he'd been summoned to. A little girl was found dead in the woods outside the city early that morning. Her body was covered in black blood, a sign that something sinister lurks outside the city walls. A number of reports on the Guard Captain's desk suggest she's just one of many victims. Against the wishes of the Lord, Avan is tasked with investigating the scene where the young girl's body was found. The night before he was set to depart, two strange figures visited his dreams. They came with an eerie message:

"Executioner...your first and your final trial waits for you there...at the temple."

It didn't mean anything. At least not then.

• • •

In Divine Omen, your choices mean life or death. Take on the role of Avan, a young doctor plagued by nightmares of his past mistakes. Use the messages in Avan's dreams to save the lives of the people close to him...or send them to an early grave. Even the most inconsequential actions can have dire consequences. Listen carefully.

Use Avan's journal to further immerse yourself in the world around you and the characters who call it home. The journal is a tool for refreshing yourself on what you've seen and even catching up on what you may have missed.

Features:

  • Story rich, choice driven narrative with horror, fantasy, and LGBTQ+ themes

  • Simple gameplay suitable for all skill levels

  • Complex, lively characters that respond to your actions

  • Journal feature provides optional character, event, and environment lore

  • Nearly 500 hand drawn sprites, backgrounds, and journal entries

  • Over 4,000 unique lines of dialogue

  • Episodic release - more to look forward to later!

  • Estimated 2.5 hours of gameplay

content_descriptors.notes: This is a horror game and it contains blood, gore, and corpses. There are some violent scenes, although they aren't the focus of the game. This game is centered around themes of mental illness, grief, and remorse. If these are things you're sensitive to, play at your own discretion. :-)

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: SteamOS (based on Linux)
  • Processor: 1 ghz or faster
  • Memory: 512 MB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 2.0 or higher, DirectX 9, OpenGL ES2, or WebGL
  • Storage: 400 MB available space

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: macOS 10.13 or higher
  • Processor: Intel-based
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Integrated/Dedicated GPU with OpenGL support
  • Storage: 400 MB available space

short_description: Divine Omen is a dark fantasy horror adventure/point-and-click/visual novel game where you control the fates of your companions. Investigate the world and relive Avan's nightmares to determine which choices must be made to save lives...or take them. Will you become the executioner?
